summary:
A quinceañera is a special 15th birthday celebration for girls in Mexican and Latin American cultures. It marks the transition from childhood to adulthood. Traditionally, girls learned skills like cooking and weaving to prepare for adulthood. During the party, the girl's father would introduce her to potential partners.

This custom is strongest in Mexico but is also celebrated in other Spanish-speaking countries and by Latino Americans in the U.S., with varying traditions. Similar celebrations exist in Brazil and French Caribbean regions.
title: Quinceañera
